verses.roman:
kṛṣṇa-bahirmukha-doṣe māyā haite bhaya
kṛṣṇonmukha bhakti haite māyā-mukta haya

synonyms: kṛṣṇa-bahiḥ-mukha—of going against Kṛṣṇa consciousness; doṣe—by the fault; māyā haite—from the illusory energy; bhaya—fear; kṛṣṇa-unmukha—in favor of Kṛṣṇa consciousness; bhakti—devotional service; haite—from; māyā-mukta—liberated from māyā; haya—one becomes.
translation: "By opposing Kṛṣṇa consciousness, one again becomes conditioned and fearful due to the influence of māyā. By executing devotional service faithfully, one is liberated from māyā.
